title: Add placeholder habits to demonstrate app usage

requirements.text: Pre-populate the backend with a set of placeholder habits so new users see example content when they first open the app. Include at least 5 varied habits such as: 'Morning Walk' (description: 'Start your day with a 30-minute walk'), 'Drink 1L of Water' (description: 'Stay hydrated throughout the day'), 'Read for 20 Minutes' (description: 'Read a book or article before bed'), 'Meditate' (description: '5-minute breathing exercise'), and 'No Junk Food' (description: 'Avoid processed snacks and sugary drinks'). These should be inserted during canister initialization (only if no habits exist yet) so they are not duplicated on upgrades.

quotes: Add some place holder habits to demonstrate how it can be used (eg: Morning walk, drink 1L of water, etc)

acceptanceCriteria: On a fresh canister deployment with no existing habits, the placeholder habits are automatically present.
Placeholder habits are not re-inserted if habits already exist (idempotent initialization).
Each placeholder habit has a meaningful name and description.
At least 5 placeholder habits are seeded.

requirements.text: Update the empty-state UI in the HabitList component to show a helpful onboarding message only when there truly are no habits, since placeholder habits will now cover most new-user scenarios. Ensure the empty state text remains accurate (e.g., 'No habits yet — tap + to add your first habit').

quotes: Add some place holder habits to demonstrate how it can be used

acceptanceCriteria: Empty state is not shown when placeholder habits are present.
Empty state is still shown correctly if all habits are somehow deleted.
Empty state message is clear and actionable.

constraints: Do not insert placeholder habits if habits already exist — initialization must be idempotent to avoid duplicates on canister upgrades.
Do not modify any files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or frontend/src/components/ui.
nonGoals: Changing the visual design or theme of the app.
Adding new habit categories or tags.
Pre-populating check-in history for the placeholder habits.
